title: Truemed, Started by MAHA Leader, Raises Funds
description: A health tech startup is testing the limits of how Americans can spend pre-tax dollars on healthcare. Truemed just raised raised $34 million in a round led by Andreessen Horowitz. Calley Means, a top adviser to Health and Human Services Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr., helped found the company. He is a key figure in Kennedy’s Make America Healthy Again movement. Truemed Chief Executive Officer Justin Mares speaks on “Bloomberg Open Interest.”
